## Discord Plugin Bootstrap Fixes

Odilitime created a branch (odi-17) with fixes for bootstrap's actions/providers to address issues users were experiencing with version 1.7.0. The main problem involved serverId vs messageServerId migration causing "No server ID found" errors when running Discord bots. A fix was submitted via PR #6333, though it still required testing with discord plugin version 1.3.3. The team discussed rushing out a release with this critical fix.

Users experiencing issues with Discord bots were advised to either wait for the fix or try using an older core version like 1.6.5. The errors were primarily related to the bootstrap plugin's handling of server IDs and user permissions.

## Contract Address (CA) Visibility Discussion

Community members raised concerns about the difficulty of finding official ElizaOS contract addresses on X/Twitter accounts. The team acknowledged this issue and committed to improving CA visibility. While some argued that top projects don't typically put CAs in their bio (as it can appear scam-like), the consensus was that the current flow doesn't work for most users.

Solutions discussed included:
- Pinned tweets on the Eliza account
- Updating the Linktree to point to CoinGecko
- Making CAs findable within 10 seconds on website/Twitter

Shaw confirmed the team would address this issue.

## ElizaOS Cloud API Integration Issues

A developer reported getting "Model not found" errors when building ElizaOS cloud agents into their website using agent IDs and API endpoints. The solution provided was to use proper model parameter formatting with provider prefixes:
- openai/gpt-4o-mini
- anthropic/claude-sonnet-4.5
- google/gemini-2.5-flash

This formatting is recommended when calling agent API endpoints from external websites.

## Unified Messaging API Updates

Stan submitted pull requests for both Telegram and Discord plugins to implement unified messaging API with ElizaOS support. The updates involved:
- Refactoring to use handleMessage instead of the deprecated sendMessage
- Updating UnifiedMessagingAPI interface
- Fixing API calls in messages.ts

PRs:
- Telegram: https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-telegram/pull/22
- Discord: https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord/pull/41

## Architecture and Infrastructure Work

Stan published an RFC (RFC-001) exploring hybrid architecture with persistent workers, available at https://hackmd.io/@0PzDTGXqRg6nOCDoEwaN-A/SyDNAAiVWe. He's also working on:
- Cloud fixes to handle TOCTOU race conditions using a deduct-before, reconcile-after approach
- Runtime initialization optimizations
- Related tickets added to Linear for tracking

Odilitime recommended reviewing the Jeju cloud branch (https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza-cloud-v2/tree/jeju/apps/discord-gateway) which contains Shaw's preferred implementation of the Discord bridge. Discussion included considerations for scaling event pumps, with voice connections requiring higher priority/bandwidth than text, and the need for preprocessing.

The team confirmed they have a workspace on HackMD at https://hackmd.io/@elizaos/book.

## Development Tools and Resources

Jin shared GitHub's agentics workflow documentation for updating docs: https://github.com/githubnext/agentics/blob/main/workflows/update-docs.md

A note was shared from a Cursor call: when using your own Claude API key in Cursor, you don't get the Cursor-optimized version of Claude (where they apply tricks to improve output).

HackMD reached out to express appreciation for ElizaOS builders using their platform.

content.text:
Two pull requests have been submitted to fix issues in the ElizaOS plugin system:

**PR #6333** by odilitime addresses a breaking change in the plugin-bootstrap and SQL plugins. This fix updates actions and providers to handle the renaming from `serverId` to `messageServerId`, ensuring compatibility across the affected plugins.

**PR #6339** by standujar resolves an issue in the plugin-sql package by skipping the pgcrypto extension when using PGLite. This prevents errors that occur when attempting to enable pgcrypto in PGLite environments where the extension is not available.

During the two-day period from January 7-8, 2026, the elizaos/eliza repository showed moderate development activity. The project received 2 new pull requests, with 1 successfully merged into the codebase. Additionally, 7 new issues were opened by users, and 7 contributors were actively engaged with the repository during this timeframe.

content.text: Issue #6310 proposes a user interface enhancement for the chat box component. The suggestion is to reduce the default size of the chat box to display only one line initially, with dynamic size adjustment that expands as users type more text across multiple lines. This improvement was contributed by borisudovicic and aims to optimize the chat interface for better space utilization and user experience.
